result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rayvon Anton Yarber

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Rayvon Anton Yarber in court.  Attorney Eugene E. Detert in court for Rayvon Anton Yarber.  Attorney Alexander James Geocaris in court for State of Wisconsin. Case adjourned to branch 11.
Status conference scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Rayvon Anton Yarber in court with Attorney Eugene E. Detert.  Edward OBrien appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR IN PERSON.
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Judge Franke. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant.   
*All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge David Swanson, Branch 11, in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Signed bond filed with the Court

Justice Point SUPERVISION.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Rayvon Anton Yarber in court with attorney Eugene E. Detert.  Alexander James Geocaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Case in court for an Initial Appearance. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings. Arguments heard as to bail. Court sets $2,000 signature bond with the conditions of Justice Point SUPERVISION and no possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. Case is adjourned for a preliminary hearing. Defendant Rayvon Anton Yarber in court.  Alexander James Geocaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.  Status conference scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.
